2019/KER/29
Crl.M.C. 22/19 -:3:-
ORDER

Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C.

2. Petitioners are accused in C.P. No.30 of 2017 on the file of
the Judicial Magistrate of First Class-l, Perumbavoor registered for the
offences under Sections 308, 341 and 427 IPC. The 2™ respondent is the
victim. It is submitted that the matter has been settled and the
proceedings in the trial court may be quashed.

3. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners and the second
respondeni and the learned Public Prosecutor.

4. | have perused the affidavit filed by the second respondent,
who has entered appearance through counsel. | am satisfied that the
matter has been settled and no public interest is involved in this case.
There is no impediment for granting the prayer of the petitioners.

In the result, this Crl.M.C is allowed. The proceedings in C.P. No.30
of 2017 on the file of the Judicial Magistrate of First Class-l, Perumbavoor
are quashed. If any material objects have been produced in this case, the
trial court may pass appropriate orders for their disposal.

Sdi/-
K.ABRAHAM MATHEW,
JUDGE
